byline.contributor: Saeed Al-Batati reported from Al Mukalla, and Kareem Fahim from Cairo.
byline.original: By SAEED AL-BATATI and KAREEM FAHIM

abstract: Islamic State claims responsibility for killing Jaafar Mohamed Saad, provincial governor of Aden, Yemen,  and eight of his bodyguards, in car bomb explosion in Tawahi; latest strike by militant group against government follows October attack on hotel which housed officials.
lead_paragraph: The governor, Jaafer Mohamed Saad, is the most senior official to be killed in the city where the embattled President Abdu Rabbu Mansour Hadi is based.

headline.main: Car Bomb Kills Governor in Aden, Yemeni Security Official Says
headline.print_headline: Islamic State Says It Killed a Governor in Yemen

snippet: The governor, Jaafer Mohamed Saad, is the most senior official to be killed in the city where the embattled President Abdu Rabbu Mansour Hadi is based.

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
